author: Ray Nimmo
title: 2013 All-Tidewater boys volleyball
text:
VIRGINIA BEACH Don’t call him a one-year wonder.
Eli Emanuelle Irizarry Pares has only been here a half-year.
Irizarry Pares, the 2013 All-Tidewater Boys Volleyball Player of the Year, grew up in Puerto Rico, moved with his family to Florida for a year and then to Virginia Beach, dropping into one of the state’s best volleyball programs.
The 6-foot-3 junior dazzled with an advanced knowledge of the game, playing outside hitter, right-side and setter at different points of the season.
“His first words were, ‘Whatever the team needs me to do,’” First Colonial coach Gary Hodges said. “You wouldn’t think that’s a rare thing but it is a rare thing.”
So were his stats. In a five-set win over rival Cox, Irizarry Pares racked up 33 assists and 24 kills – numbers normally split between two players.
Irizarry Pares credits watching film – something he’s done since he was 12 years old – and attending professional volleyball matches in Puerto Rico for his precocious talents. But they aren’t attributes he broadcasts.
“People ask me if I’m a very good player and I don’t like to tell them an answer,” Irizarry Pares said. “Because then they will think I am cocky. I’m not that type of person to brag about that.”
He also wasn’t one to bemoan injuries. Irizarry Pares dealt with knee and ankle troubles throughout the year. He had tendinitis in his left knee a couple years ago and it flares up occasionally. He twisted his ankle over the summer and his first action back was high school tryouts.
“You could tell,” said Hodges, who sometimes kept Irizarry Pares from jumping at practices. “He was stiff at times. But he never complained about it. If he gets 100 percent healthy, he’ll be even more dominant than he was.”
First Colonial (27-3) won the Conference 1 regular-season title, part of a 20-match winning streak. The Patriots fell in the Eastern Zone semifinals to eventual state champion Princess Anne.
“It was very hard because everyone I talked to at school, they had high hopes for us,” Irizarry Pares said.
The early elimination stung, but one memory Hodges will keep with him is when Irizarry Pares cracked an attack off an opposing player’s head. Irizarry Pares, who led the team in honor calls, didn’t boast.
“The first thing he did,” Hodges said, “was walk under the net to check and make sure he was OK.”
____
ALL-TIDEWATER FIRST TEAM
PLAYER OF THE YEAR | Eli Emanuelle Irizarry Pares , First Colonial
6-foot-3 junior setter/outside hitter Conference 1 co-Player of the Year Recorded 307 kills, 233 assists, 59 digs, 59 blocks and 49 aces “Does everything at a high level.” – coach Gary Hodges ____
Kyle Barnes , Princess Anne
6-foot-3 junior outside hitter Conference 9 Player of the Year Averaged 12 kills, two blocks and two aces per match Barnes stood out on the deepest team in Virginia, stifling opponents with a rocket arm, jump serve and dependable passing. “The most consistent hitter in the state.” – coach Jeff Kinser ____
Seth Blevins , First Colonial
6-foot-3 junior outside hitter/setter Tallied 302 kills, 147 assists, 55 digs, 43 blocks and 38 aces All-Conference 1 first team Already one of the best hitters in the state, Blevins added setting to his resume this year. He was one-half of the Patriots’ 1-2 punch with Irizarry Pares. ____
Erich Bratke , Salem
6-foot senior setter All-Conference 9 first team Amassed 651 assists, 127 kills, 185 digs, 63 aces and 58 blocks A four-year starter for Salem, Bratke helped maintain the SunDevils’ status as a contender. “Superb court sense.” – coach Shari Bishop ____
Jason Brewster , Western Branch
6-foot-3 senior outside hitter Conference 2 Player of the Year Posted 393 kills with a .364 hitting percentage, 112 digs, 62 aces and 22 blocks Brewster helped bring the Bruins (21-5) back to volleyball prominence. “He was our go-to hitter and didn’t let us down this year. He was our primary passer in serve-receive and did an excellent job keeping us in system.” – coach David Arnette ____
Will Calaman , Cox
5-foot-7 junior libero All-Conference 1 first team Had 189 digs and 14 aces Perhaps the state’s best libero and passer, Calaman came up big in the postseason as competition increased. “Will is the quickest, most dynamic libero in Tidewater.” – coach Jason Zuidema ____
Brett Rosenmeier , Cox
6-foot-3 junior outside hitter Conference 1 co-Player of the Year Recorded 325 kills, 59 digs, 39 aces and 29 blocks Maybe the state’s best pure hitter, Rosenmeier intimidated opponents with each attack and, at times, looked unstoppable. He also boasted a hard-hitting jump serve. ____
SECOND TEAM
Russell Dervay , junior setter, Cox
Connor Haymaker , senior outside hitter, Salem
Chase Howard , sophomore middle/outside hitter, Princess Anne
Eli Gabriel Irizarry Pares , freshman outside hitter/setter, First Colonial
James Knight , junior outside hitter, Hickory
Shane Limbaugh , sophomore outside hitter, Maury
John Whiteman , senior outside hitter, Ocean Lakes
Ray Nimmo, 757-446-2364; ray.nimmo@pilotonline.com
Eli Emanuelle Irizarry Pares, who starred this year for First Colonial, is the 2013 All-Tidewater boys volleyball Player of the Year. (L. Todd Spencer | The Virginian-Pilot)
